alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Grant; Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 11:10AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...LOCALIZED BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW CONTINUES THIS AFTERNOON... Locally strong and gusty winds will continue along the eastern slopes of the Sisseton Hills this afternoon. Westerly winds of 15 to 25 mph with occasional gusts over 35 mph are likely. The locations most affected will be the higher terrain areas of the Sisseton Hills as well as up to 15 miles east of the hills. This includes Interstate 29 between Summit and Peever, or between mile markers 210 and 225. U.S. Highway 12 from Summit to Milbank may also experience strong winds. The strong winds will promote blowing and drifting snow, along with low visibility at times. Anyone with travel plans across far northeast South Dakota should be prepared for inclement weather and are urged to slow down and allow for extra distance between vehicles if need be, especially along I-29 between Summit and Peever. Winds are expected to diminish by early evening.
